alert.note: Alert for Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Guilford and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen, with additional heavy rain expected. This is the same area where 2 to 4 inches of rain fell yesterday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, Randleman, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Liberty, Staley, and Climax.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
